conclusion: Analyzing how shadows A, B, C, and D will change when the light source moves to the back right.
Object A is an apple casting shadow A.
Object B is a small white rectangular object casting shadow B.
Object C is partially visible and casting shadow C.
Object D is a spoon-like object casting shadow D.
Current shadows suggest the light source is positioned toward the front left of the scene.
General shadow behavior when a light source moves: shadows move opposite, grow longer when lower or angled, become shorter when overhead.
Shadow A will move toward front left, elongate, and become less circular when light moves to back right.
Shadow B will move toward front left, become longer, and show more definition when light moves to back right.
Shadow C will move toward front left, become longer, and show more definition when light moves to back right.
Shadow D will move toward front left, elongate significantly, and the handle portion will become more pronounced when light moves to back right.
All shadows will move toward front left, maintain relative positions, increase in size, and elongate more for taller objects.
Final answer: Shadows A, B, C, and D will move toward front left, increase in size, become more elongated, and maintain overall pattern but shifted.
